intro: Agalinis purpurea var. parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered purpletop, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and typically grows in moist, open habitats such as prairies and woodland edges. The plant features slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers that are usually purple or pink in color. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It is an annual or biennial plant that plays a role in supporting pollinators and maintaining ecological diversity in its native range.
